definitions: the action of shooting at someone from a hiding place, especially accurately and at long range

examples.text: sniping assumed great importance during WWI, especially where trench warfare was prevalent

shortDefinitions: action of shooting at someone from hiding place

definitions: the action of verbally attacking someone in a sly or petty way

examples.text: there has been some sniping about inept leadership

shortDefinitions: action of verbally attacking someone in sly or petty way

definitions: (in an online auction) the action or practice of placing a bid judged to be high enough to win an item just before the bidding is scheduled to close
shortDefinitions: (in online auction) practice of placing bid just before bidding closes
